pull_request.title: Checkout Page UI | Logged-in user preview and Change Email button
pull_request.body:
This PR implements an important UI update for logged-in users on the Checkout page. It's a new logged-in user preview and **Change Email** button. I think this simplifies the checkout process for logged-in users. The video preview is attached.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40078038/230238210-38aa6b96-3d11-46fc-a99d-615db49d49ea.mp4

issue.title: Get the download's type with appropriate method
issue.body: Fixes https://github.com/awesomemotive/easy-digital-downloads/issues/9686

comment.body: Given what @cklosowski pointed out in https://github.com/awesomemotive/easy-digital-downloads/issues/9686#issuecomment-1775641000, I'm going to close this PR.

issue.title: Trying to get `EDD_Download`'s type with property instead of using `get_type()`

labels.name: workflow-pending-triage
labels.description: Items that need to be triaged and reviewed before they are worked on.

issue.body:
## Bug Report
`EDD_Download`'s `$type` property is not set when the class is instantiated. The `$type` property is only set when `EDD_Download->get_type()` is first called. So, we need to make sure that we always try to retrieve the download's type by using the appropriate method, instead of trying `EDD_Download->type` directly. The issue is that this is not done in `edd_get_download_type()` ([see here](https://github.com/awesomemotive/easy-digital-downloads/blob/main/includes/download-functions.php#L625))

### Information (if a specific version is affected):
EDD Version (or branch): 3.2.3

WordPress Version:

Any other relevant information:
Happens in the Pro plugin as well.

comment.body: @cklosowski You're absolutely right, thank you for pointing that out. I must have found an issue on my end and wrongly attributed to how `edd_get_download_type()` got the type, I'm sorry. I'm going ahead and closing this issue.

issue.body:
## Bug Report
`EDD_Download`'s `$type` property is not set when the class is instantiated. The `$type` property is only set when `EDD_Download->get_type()` is first called. So, we need to make sure that we always try to retrieve the download's type by using the appropriate method, instead of trying `EDD_Download->type` directly. The issue is that this is not done in `edd_get_download_type()` ([see here](https://github.com/awesomemotive/easy-digital-downloads/blob/main/includes/download-functions.php#L625))

issue.title: Trying to get `EDD_Download`'s type with property instead of using `get_type()`

labels.name: workflow-pending-triage
labels.description: Items that need to be triaged and reviewed before they are worked on.

issue.body:
## Bug Report
`EDD_Download`'s `$type` property is not set when the class is instantiated. The `$type` property is only set when `EDD_Download->get_type()` is first called. So, we need to make sure that we always try to retrieve the download's type by using the appropriate method, instead of trying `EDD_Download->type` directly. The issue is that this is not done in `edd_get_download_type()` ([see here](https://github.com/awesomemotive/easy-digital-downloads/blob/main/includes/download-functions.php#L625))

### Information (if a specific version is affected):
EDD Version (or branch): 3.2.3

WordPress Version:

Any other relevant information:
Happens in the Pro plugin as well.

comment.body: @goncalovf The `EDD_Download` class sets the property of `type` to private, and we have a magic getter method `__get()`. So while the value is not set while instantiating it, it is retrieved and set when using `$download->type` as a private property will run through the `__get` method, which then looks up the type via a `get_meta` call.

pull_request.title: Fix key mismatch between pricing variations and downloads array at `get_variable_priced_bundled_downloads()`

issue.title: Mismatch between arrays with different initial indexes at `get_variable_priced_bundled_downloads()`

labels.name: workflow-pending-triage
labels.description: Items that need to be triaged and reviewed before they are worked on.

issue.body:
## Bug Report
When I do X, I expect Y to happen.

In `includes/admin/downloads/views/metabox-bundled-products.php`, the value for the `_edd_bundled_products_conditions` meta is inserted as an array of initial index of 1, instead of 0 ([see here](https://github.com/awesomemotive/easy-digital-downloads/blob/main/includes/admin/downloads/views/metabox-bundled-products.php#L34)). This creates a mistmatch at `EDD_Download->get_variable_priced_bundled_downloads()`, where we're using an index of `_edd_bundled_products_conditions` to select a download from an array of initial index of 0.

### Information (if a specific version is affected):
EDD Version (or branch): 3.2.3

Any other relevant information:
Happens in the Pro plugin as well.

issue.title: Add to Cart" Button Does Not Redirect to Checkout for Logged-In Users

labels.name: workflow-pending-triage
labels.description: Items that need to be triaged and reviewed before they are worked on.

issue.body:
## Bug Report
When the customer selects the add to cart button it should redirect to the checkout page

### Actual behavior
If the customer adds the product to the cart it's not redirected to the checkout page

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

1. Create a simple product
2. Create a simple product with a Buy Now option
3. Create a page with EDD Product block
4. Set 'Redirect to Checkout' => Yes
5. Login as a user
6. Add to the cart the simple product and it will add the product to checkout, but after the refresh, the customer remains on the same page

**Note:**
Make sure you are logged in with a user to test this process. For non-login it's working fine

### Information (if a specific version is affected):
PHP Version: 8.0

EDD Version (or branch): 3.2.3

WordPress Version: 6.3.2

issue.title: Add 'apply_filters' to 'EDD_Download' class 'support_buy_now()' function return value
issue.body:
Since EDD v3.2.2, in some custom payment processors plugins like FastSpring by ProtheusPay (https://proteuspay.com/), the 'Buy Now' functionality stopped to work with recurring payments. If that's going to be the default behavior (don't work with recurring payments), the ideal would be at least provide a hook to be able to change that behavior with custom code.
Fixes #

Proposed Changes:
1. Encapsulate the logic to check whether buy now is supported or not in a new 'is_buy_now_supported' function to be able to apply the filter.
2. Add the filter 'edd_download_supports_buy_now' in the return value from function 'supports_buy_now'

_Please do not submit PRs with minified CSS or JS files. This is managed at the time of release by the Core Team_
